nodes.text:
This message is for High Lady Kamea Arano of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAuriganReach],Aurigan Reach]].

 I am Elena Marisol-Chaplin, personal attaché to [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreThomasCalderon],Protector Thomas Calderon]] of the [[DM.Factions[faction_TaurianConcordat],Taurian Concordat]].
nodes.comment: Fade In, GC_440_ARMISTICE, Set viewscreen: Elena

nodes.text:
The Taurian Ministry of Intelligence has confirmed the authenticity of the evidence that you sent us.

You have our thanks. It would seem that your uncle's duplicity has left its mark on us all.

branches.responseText: Wherever you are, Lord Madeira… thank you.

nodes.text:
Our ambassadors have been in communication with representatives of the [[DM.Factions[faction_Davion],Federated Suns]], and they are negotiating a deescalation of force along our shared border. All cooperation between the Taurian Concordat and the Directorate has officially been terminated.

We have also withdrawn our fleet, and Director Santiago Espinosa has been recognized as an enemy of the Taurian state. Should he ever dare to leave Aurigan space, he will have us to contend with.

Finally: I will personally review your reports of Taurian war crimes in the Reach. If I find them credible, I will hold Commodore Ostergaard accountable for his actions upon his return.

If what you've told me is true, he will stand before a firing squad—you have my word.

With that, our business is concluded. Be well, Lady Arano.

Protector Calderon wishes you success in your campaign to come.
[The image on the viewscreen cuts out as the recording comes to an end.]

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Deep Periphery]</color> Just a heads up, all: if I ever have to deal with anything like this again, I'm skipping town for the Deep Periphery. You're all welcome to join me.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Rimward Periphery]</color> The whole Rimward Periphery can breathe a little easier now that they're backing down. The Reach, the Magistracy… all of us.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Draconis Combine]</color> I wouldn't bet on any sort of lasting peace between the Taurians and the Federation. They'll probably lapse back into a cold war.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Free Worlds League]</color> I wouldn't bet on any sort of lasting peace between the Taurians and the Federation. They'll probably lapse back into a cold war.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Lyran Commonwealth]</color> I wouldn't bet on any sort of lasting peace between the Taurians and the Federation. They'll probably lapse back into a cold war.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Capellan Confederation]</color> I wouldn't bet on any sort of lasting peace between the Taurians and the Federation. They'll probably lapse back into a cold war.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Taurian Concordat]</color> If I were Espinosa, I'd be sweating bullets right now. My people have a low tolerance for betrayal.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Federated Suns]</color> I'm pleasantly surprised. Maybe now they'll stop hurling baseless accusations at House Davion.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Ancestry: Magistracy of Canopus]</color> I'm pleasantly surprised. Maybe now my people will be able to breathe a little easier.
Well. That's that, then. The Restoration's problems with the Taurians are over.
I hope they broadcast Ostergaard's execution.

nodes.text:
That actually sounds pretty great, Commander. No, seriously.

After the war is over, maybe we could take a little field trip and leave all this ridiculous infighting behind.

I wouldn't count on this lasting long, Boss. They'll probably just lapse back into some sort of half-assed cold war… one that'll go hot again as soon as either side gets jumpy.

Still, for the time being, I'll take what I can get.

Yeah, one that'll flare up hot again as soon as either side gets jumpy.

Still, for the time being, I'll take what I can get.

I'm with you there, Yang. Lady Arano, I think that congratulations are in order.

With Tyrlon liberated and the Taurians out of the war, there's nothing left between us and the throne.

That's an understatement. Espinosa is righteously screwed.

Even if he somehow makes it through the Restoration's attack on Coromodir, he's a dead man. His fate has already been sealed.

I agree with you in spirit, Commander. It's nice to know that my people won't be invaded by the Federation anytime soon.

I'm very deliberately emphasizing the "anytime soon" in that sentence, by the way. But we can worry about the future another day.

Mine, too. It's good to know that we don't need to worry about a Federation invasion force coming across our border anytime soon.

…Emphasis on the "anytime soon," of course, but we can worry about the future another day.

Good. If I never have to worry about another Taurian DropShip coming after me again, it'll be too soon. Besides, the Taurians are the good guys. We never should've been fighting them in the first place.

In any case, Lady Arano… I think that congratulations are in order.

With Tyrlon liberated and the Taurians out of the war, there's nothing left between us and the throne.

The Directorate still has one card they can play. They have Lord Madeira.

When we move on Coromodir, I will negotiate for his release… but first, I must rally the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreFoundingHouses],Founding Houses]]. When I travel to Coromodir, it will be with all of our allies—and their armies—at my back. I want the throne world's skies crowded with our DropShips.
What about the people there? When your invasion fleet touches down, will you have their support?

Yes, I will. Every victory we've won has shaken their support of my uncle. His popularity as a leader is shattered, and when the time to invade comes, the majority will side with us.

With our fleet filling the skies and our supporters in the streets, my message will be unmistakable. Everywhere my uncle looks, he will see the Arano cormorant—the symbol of my House, and of our unshakable resolve.

branches.responseText: Don't forget about us. When you talk to that bastard, I want to be right there by your side.
What you're saying is, you're gonna drag your uncle into negotiations with a gun pressed to his head.
Sounds like a plan. We'll be waiting for your call.

nodes.text:
You will be, {COMMANDER.Callsign}; you have my word on that. "Director Espinosa" will see our strength—the strength of our fleet, of our unity, of the loyalty of our people. And he will return Lord Madeira to us, or we will destroy him utterly.

Be ready for my call, Commander… together we will bring this war to a close.

He deserves no less. "Director Espinosa" will see our strength—the strength of our fleet, of our unity, of the loyalty of our people. And he will return Lord Madeira to us, or we will destroy him utterly.

Be ready for my call, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. When I negotiate with my uncle, I'll need you by my side.

Good. "Director Espinosa" will see our strength—the strength of our fleet, of our unity, and of the loyalty of our people.

He will return Lord Madeira to us, or we will destroy him utterly. Be ready for my summons, {COMMANDER.Callsign}—it's long past time for us to bring this war to a close.
That reminds me, Boss… the galley's out of popcorn. I'll stock up the next time we're in port.
